titleStmt.title: The worthye booke of old age othervvyse entituled the elder Cato contayning a learned defence and praise of age, and aged men: writen in latine by that father of eloquence Marcus Tullius Cicero, and now englished. VVherunto is annexed a recitall of diuerse men that liued long. With a declaracion of sundrye soortes of yeares, and the diuersitie betwene the yeres in the old time, and our yeares nowe adayes. Anno. 1569
Cato maior de senectute. English
titleStmt.author: Cicero, Marcus Tullius.
Newton, Thomas, 1542?-1607.

titleStmt.title: The worthye booke of old age othervvyse entituled the elder Cato contayning a learned defence and praise of age, and aged men: writen in latine by that father of eloquence Marcus Tullius Cicero, and now englished. VVherunto is annexed a recitall of diuerse men that liued long. With a declaracion of sundrye soortes of yeares, and the diuersitie betwene the yeres in the old time, and our yeares nowe adayes. Anno. 1569

notesStmt.note: A translation of: Cato Major de senectute.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
